lead_paragraph: Jenny Wolf of Germany beat her own world record yesterday in winning the women’s 500 meters at a World Cup race in Calgary, Alberta. Wolf’s time of 37.02 seconds lowered the 37.04 she skated March 10 in Salt Lake City. Her 10.13 for the first 100 meters was also a record. Jeremy Wotherspoon of Canada won the men’s 500.
